1.verse: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

2.verse: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

3.verse: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

4.verse: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

5.verse: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

6.verse: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

7.verse: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

8.verse: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

9.verse: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

10.verse: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

11.verse: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

12.verse: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

13.verse: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.

14.verse: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

15.verse: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

16.verse: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

17.verse: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

18.verse: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

19.verse: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

20.verse: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

21.verse: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

22.verse: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

23.verse: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

24.verse: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

25.verse: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
